properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: ROAD DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR BURNS LAKE, SMITHERS, QUESNEL AND VERNON The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has continued a Road Dust Advisory for Burns Lake and Smithers because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation or dust suppression. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. Exposure is particularly a concern for pregnant women, infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-03-22T17:07:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2020-03-22T01:08:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1956980693.2020
Area: North Okanagan, Cariboo - north including Quesnel, Bulkley Valley, Lakes District
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Civil Emergency, Alert From Sk Provincial Emergency Communications Centre
properties.Summary:
Description: This emergency advisory alert is being issued for the province of Saskatchewan. All travelers returning from outside of Canada are subject to a mandatory 14 day self isolation order. Violation of the order may result in a fine of 2000 dollars.
Expires: 2020-03-28T12:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-03-21T16:40:10-06:00, 6EDD6E54-AF03-4B21-7CFB-7CE5BAF6039B
Area: Province of Saskatchewan
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Additional snowfall accumulation: trace to 5 cm. Peak wind gusts: northwesterly 110 km/h. Locations: Postville-Makkovik to Natuashish. Time span: continuing until overnight tonight. Remarks: Snow will taper to flurries near midnight, but strong northwesterly winds winds will continue to reduce visibility at times to near zero in blowing snow. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-22T10:59:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-22T01:14:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3101021085.2020
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong westerly and southwesterly winds up to 110 kilometres per hour are expected beginning overnight tonight over these regions. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-22T17:15:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-22T01:16:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2950540459.2020
Area: Salluit, Kangiqsujuaq - Raglan Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: West winds will reach up to 90 kilometres per hour beginning Sunday morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-22T17:18:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-22T01:19:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3793109187.2020
Area: Kangirsuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very strong winds that may cause damage are expected. Very strong northwest winds, with gusts up to 90 km/h, will develop early Sunday morning. In addition, near blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are also expected Sunday morning. Throughout Sunday afternoon the wind will weaken and the visibility will improve. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-22T19:21:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-22T03:22:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2861086658.2020
Area: Tuktoyaktuk - East Channel Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Additional snowfall accumulation: 5 cm. Peak wind gusts: northwesterly 100 km/h. Locations: Black Tickle to Rigolet. Time span: until overnight tonight. Remarks: Snow will taper to flurries near midnight, but strong winds will continue to produce near-zero visibilities in blowing snow tonight. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-22T10:59:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-22T01:12:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3112724755.2020
Area: Cartwright to Black Tickle, Rigolet and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring. Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected. Strong northwest winds, with gusts up to 70 km/h, will develop early Sunday morning. These strong winds will be accompanied with falling snow, which will result in poor visibility in blowing snow. Conditions will improve Sunday afternoon as the wind weakens and the snow ends. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-22T19:21:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-22T03:22:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3072991577.2020
Area: Aklavik Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada
